ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Interconnect_module_constraint_region is a type of . An Interconnect_module_constraint_region is a region within an in which a placement constraint on some category of design object is to be met by the design. An Interconnect_module_constraint_region may overlap other Interconnect_module_constraint_regions.

ext_description.p: the precedent_version_constraint_region is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Interconnect_module_constraint_region is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Interconnect_module_constraint_region as its . There shall be zero or one for an Interconnect_module_constraint_region. The usage of this relationship is to enable traceability to original Interconnect_module_constraint_region during design iterations.
ext_description.note: Since the Interconnect_module_constraint_region is dependent on a specific , it is not possible to use the mechanism of associating one Interconnect_module_constraint_region with several , each of which is for a different design version. In addition, the non_conformant_interconnect_module_design_object is for objects within the scope, which also precludes direct re-use of the same Interconnect_module_constraint_region. It is expected that only the first Interconnect_module_constraint_region populated would have an associated shape to eliminate the need for carrying redundant shape data.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the constrained_design_object_category specifies the for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region. The constrained_design_object_category specifies either an interconnect_module_cutout, an interconnect_module_fill_area, an interconnect_module_inter_stratum_feature, an interconnect_module_stratum_feature, or an interconnect_module_via as a category for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region. There may be more than one interconnect_module_cutout, interconnect_module_fill_area, interconnect_module_inter_stratum_feature, or interconnect_module_via for an Interconnect_module_constraint_region. The names shall be interpreted as the identification of Application Object categories to be constrained.

the associated_stratum_extent specifies the as the extent of for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region. There shall be one or more for an Interconnect_module_constraint_region. The shall all be for the same scope.

the design_specific_purpose specifies the for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region. The design_specific_purpose identifies the purpose the enterprise defined for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region.
the scope specifies the role of the for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region.

the non_conformant_interconnect_module_design_object specifies the for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region. There shall be one or more for each Interconnect_module_constraint_region.
The non_conformant_interconnect_module_design_object specifies either a , a , a , a , an , a , a , a , a , or a for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region. There shall be more than one , , , , , , , , , or Via for an Interconnect_module_constraint_region. The value of this attribute is optional and need not be specified.

the keepout specifies if the meaning of the Interconnect_module_constraint_region is to describe that items shall be in the interior of the element_shape or shall be on the exterior of the element_shape. The value of TRUE states that objects in the constrained_design_object_category are not to be within the element_shape. The value of FALSE states that objects in the constrained_design_object_category are to be only within the element_shape.

ext_description.p:
A Layer_qualified_layout_spacing_requirement_occurrence is a type of that describes the physical spacing between one of an interconnect_module_cutout, an interconnect_module_fill_area, an interconnect_module_inter_stratum_feature, an interconnect_module_stratum_feature, or an interconnect_module_via, and another of these categories of design objects. This Application object qualifies the spacing requirement to apply within a given context as defined by a set of .
The category names correspond to the category of equivalent application object names as described in . This requirement shall be interpreted as applying to the categories of those objects.
ext_description.note: A pair of categories is used for this requirement occurrence.
ext_description.example: In domain terms, when a Via to Via spacing is to be greater than 5 mm, the encoding will be that the spacing between the reference_design_object_category whose value is interconnect_module_via and the dependent_design_object_category whose value is interconnect_module_via shall be greater than 5 mm.

In domain terms, when the distance from a cutout to a trace must be greater than 5 mm, the encoding will be that the spacing between the reference_design_object_category whose value is interconnect_module_cutout and the dependent_design_object_category whose value is interconnect_module_stratum_feature shall be greater than 5 mm.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the layer_context specifies an , for the Layer_qualified_layout_spacing_requirement_occurrence. The layer_context establishes a context within which the spacing requirement is to be met. There shall be one or more for a Layer_qualified_layout_spacing_requirement_occurrence. The may overlap. All specified shall be in the same design.
A Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object specifies one or more design object that does not meet object to object spacing requirements for the printed circuit board layout.
the design_requirement specifies the role of the for the Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object

ext_description.p: the reference_design_object specifies the for the Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object. The reference_design_object specifies one role of either an , a , or one of a , a , a , a , an , a , a , a , a , or a for the Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object.
ext_description.note: This data is the result of an evaluation of the difference between the board layout and the original spacing requirements.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the non-conformant_design_object specifies the for the Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object. The non_conformant_design_object specifies one role of either an , a , or one of a , a , a , a , an , a , a , a , a , or a for the Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object. There shall be one or more , , , , , , , , , , , or Via for each Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object.
